item.title: Dash add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Dash add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Art is not a mirror held up to reality but a hammer with which to shape it." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Dash add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Dash add a quote by Richard Leigh
item.description: "You’ve got to sing like you don’t need the money, Love like you’ll never get hurt. You’ve got to dance like nobody’s watchin’." -- Richard Leigh

item.title: Dash add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Dash add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Dash add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Dash add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "It may be that our role on this planet is not to worship God--but to create him." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Dash add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Do not fear death so much, but rather the inadequate life" -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Dash add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "He thought in other heads, and in his own, others besides himself thought" -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Dash add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "The aim of science is not to open the door to infinite wisdom, but to set a limit to infinite error." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Dash add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The tears of the world are a constant quantity. For each one who begins to weep somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Dash add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "You're on Earth. There's no cure for that." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Dash add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Dash add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Estragon: People are bloody ignorant apes." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Dash add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The end is in the beginning and yet you go on." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Dash add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Dash add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Dash add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "Time passed slowly, like and old man climbing a hill." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Dash add a quote by Roger Zelazny
item.description: "...the headwaters of Shit Creek are a cruel and treacherous expanse." -- Roger Zelazny

item.title: Dash add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Dash add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "I know that pain is the most important thing in the universes. Greater than survival, greater than love, greater even than the beauty it brings about. For without pain, there can be no pleasure. Without sadness, there can be no happiness. Without misery there can be no beauty. And without these, life is endless, hopeless, doomed and damned. Adult. You have become adult." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Dash add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Dash add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "be careful of monsters with teeth" -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Dash add a quote by Theodore Sturgeon
item.description: "Why must we love where the lightning strikes, and not where we choose? " -- Theodore Sturgeon

item.title: Dash add a quote by paraphrased from Theodore Sturgeon, award-winning science fiction writer in the 1950's
item.description: "Sure, 90% of science fiction is crud. That's because 90% of everything is crud." -- paraphrased from Theodore Sturgeon, award-winning science fiction writer in the 1950's

item.title: Dash add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Dash add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "The philosophy of Atheism represents a concept of life without any metaphysical Beyond or Divine Regulator. It is the concept of an actual, real world with its liberating, expanding and beautifying possibilities, as against an unreal world, which, with its spirits, oracles, and mean contentment has kept humanity in helpless degradation." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Dash add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: " Free love? As if love is anything but free! Man has bought brains, but all the millions in the world have failed to buy love. Man has subdued bodies, but all the power on earth has been unable to subdue love. Man has conquered whole nations, but all his armies could not conquer love. Man has chained and fettered the spirit, but he has been utterly helpless before love. High on a throne, with all the splendor and pomp his gold can command, man is yet poor and desolate, if love passes him by. And if it stays, the poorest hovel is radiant with warmth, with life and color. Thus love has the magic power to make of a beggar a king. Yes, love is free; it can dwell in no other atmosphere. In freedom it gives itself unreservedly, abundantly, completely. All the laws on the statutes, all the courts in the universe, cannot tear it from the soil, once love has taken root." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Dash add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "Anarchism, then, really stands for the liberation of the human mind from the dominion of religion; the liberation of the human body from the dominion of property; liberation from the shackles and restraint of government." -- Emma Goldman
